text:
April 14, 1954
Mr. G. H. Griffiths
Fund for Adult Education
1444 Wentworth Avenue
Pasadena 5, California
Dear Bills
Had hoped to have this Committee meet at Columbus. Unfortunately I
couldn’t get the Committee named until after we left. Hence there
will be a slight delay. To each of these persons I sent also a copy
of your letter,
Hope you received the interim reports on New York 1954 TV Study. If
you need more copies we can have some run off. I hope the final
report will be available fairly soon, however*.
The Placement service is going slowly. sorry we don’t have funds
for Wsllcer to travel* Already have a pending $10,000.00 Headquarters
deficit for this year. (Too many requests for services). Also
feel that psychologically Walker cou3.d do little with a Waghingtch
trip except run into frustrations. We therefore are agaiijWfcart at
scratch, which has meant a considerable waste of Walker’s time so
far. However, we’re prepared to do what we can.
So far received frpr. Mrs. Kelly several months ago was a short capsule
mention for pur NfeWS.Iott.erf of a few candidates, whose files were not
sent or dipped into too deeply.
Will try to keep on top of everything, I imagine you are as busy
as we are-*.-which is mighty busy.
1 t
Sincerely,
I
Harry Skomla
Executive Director
